Description: St Antony; the saints stands in the centre, with cross and pig; inscribed above; second state Engraving
Producer name: Print made by: Israhel van Meckenem (?)
Curator's comments: Copy in reverse after Schongauer. In one of the two Hollstein entries (in the Meckenem volume), the print is referred to as "Not by Meckenem". All other catalogues list the work as one of Meckenem's works. The name of the saint appears only on the second state and was added, according to Lehrs, in the XVII century.
Bibliographic references: Lehrs 1908-34 / Geschichte und kritische Katalog des deutschen, niederländischen und französischen Kupferstichs im XV Jahrhundert (IX.263.314.II)
Hollstein / German engravings, etchings and woodcuts c.1400-1700 (314)
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Acquisition notes: Purchased directly from the Albertina collection as a duplicate from the Hofbibliothek.
